name: PLA
description: PLA (polylactic acid), is a thermoplastic polymer derived from renewable resources. This feature sets it apart from other commonly used plastics. PLA is great for low cost prototyping, containers, and functional parts under a light load.

name: PETG
description: PETG is a strong, durable plastic similar to ABS but safe for human health. It is chemical- and wear-resistant, making it suitable for outdoor and food-related applications. Made from modified polyethylene terephthalate (PET), PETG is tougher, stiffer, and clearer.

name: ABS
description: ABS (Acrylonitrile Butadiene Styrene) is ideal for functional parts and prototypes requiring stronger mechanical properties than PLA. It retains about 80% of the qualities of injection-molded products but is rigid and inflexible, limiting design freedom in FDM printing.

name: TPU
description: Thermoplastic polyurethane (TPU) is a common elastic polymer for FDM 3D printing. TPU has a Shore hardness of 85A-95A, offering high flexibility, durability, and strength. It can withstand greater compressive and tensile forces than PLA and ABS.
